name: 數學物理（一）
description: 教授物理系必修課程中所需之數學概念及技巧，使學生具備扎實的數學運算能力，以作為了解高深物理原理的基礎。
goals: 具有數學邏輯推導與演算的能力
syllabus:
**授課方式：16+2週. 彈性授課為第17週及第18週, 進行方式為自主學習**

Weeks 1 to 4:

I. ORDINARY DIFFERENTIAL EQUATIONS (ODEs):  
A. Introduction. B. Examples of First Order Differential Equations. C. Exact ODEs. D. Integrating Factors. E. Linear ODEs and Bernoulli Equation. F. 2nd order ODEs: homogeneous Equations. G. 2nd order ODEs: nonhomogeneous Equations. H. Higher order ODEs and sets of ODEs. I. Laplace Transform.

Weeks 5, 7, 8:

II. INFINITE SERIES and SERIS SOLUTIONS OF ODEs: A. Introduction and Definition. B. Convergence Tests. C. Alternating Series. D. Series of Functions. E. Power Series. F. Series solutions of ODEs.

Week 6: First midterm exam (open book).

Weeks 8, 9, 10, 12:

III. VECTOR ANALYSIS: A. Definition and Examples. B. Basic Operations on Vectors. C. Vector Diff erential Calculus : Gradient, Divergence and Curl. D. Vector Integral Calculus : Vector Integrals and Vector Integral Theorems. E. Application to Electrodynamics.

Week 11: Second midterm (open book)

Weeks 12 to 15:

IV. VECTOR ANALYSIS IN CURVILINEAR COORDINATES: A. General Introduction to Orthogonal Coordinates. B. Circular Cylindrical Coordinates. C. Spherical Polar Coordinates, D. Differential Vector Operators in Cylindrical and Spherical Coordinates.

Weeks 15 to 16:

V. MATRICES (PART I): A. Motivation for Matrices : Solving a Set of Linear Equations. B. Basic Operations on Matrices. C. Determinant of a Matrix. D. Inverse of a Matrix. E. Eigenvalues, Eigenvectors and diagonalization of a Matrix. F. Hermitian and Unitary Matrices.

Final exam week: Open book final exam.

Weeks 17, 18: 自主學習

VI. INTRODUCTION TO GROUP THEORY: A. Definition and Examples of Group. B. Generators of Continuous Groups. C. SO(3) and SU(2). D. Angular Momentum in Quantum Mechanics.

grading.note: A. There will be 5 to 6 homework assignments. B. Students are encouraged to discuss homework with their classmates. C. The hand in manuscripts must be written by each students individually. D. No credit for late homework.
There will be two in class (open book) midterm exams.
There will be an in class (open book) final exam.
